title: TROLL AND BAD TEAMS AND ITS UNFAIR IF I ALWAYS DO GOOD
body: i swear to fucking god riot.... have you guys seen my fuckingg games????? the teams im getting is so unfair as they are always feeding their lanes and losing every fucking game. its not fair to me in rank as i just lose lp constantly when i shouldnt be. im doing good every fuckingg game and only reason why im losing all the time and dropping divisions is because the teams i end up in........ FIX YOUR SYSTEM WITH THE TEAMS! JSUT LOOK AT MY MATCH HISTORY ITS NOT EVEN FUCKING FAIR!!!!!

replies.body:
Team mates are just tools for your own success. Stop treating them like teammates, and play like you're the only one. Use your teammates to better yourself. 

See them less as players and more as batteries. They're helpful until they run out of use. 

At least with this method of thinking the game isn't as personal.

Sorry to burt ya bubble kid, but you're trash.. 
Platinum 5
0 LP / 167W 193L 
Win Ratio 46%

How about you focus on yourself instead of trying to blame your teams only reason you're hard stuck plat is you..

Well, literally all you've provided about the situation is a K/D ratio, which gives us practically nothing useful to work off. If LoL were a "Team Deathmatch" game, that would be enough, but it's not.

A players skill and ability in games like LoL is reflected in much more than the K/D/A ratio, such as CS, Ward usage/placements, Kill participation, objective control, ability usage and resource management, item builds (including runes), strategies used (at various points through a given match) and so much more, a lot of which can't be explained/demonstrated in simple statistics.

Those sort of games can happen, but rarely. You don't get that in more than half of your games. If you've played over 350 games and start to get stuck, you need to improve to climb further because you've hit your current level wall. No point blaming teams for it.

I did read that. While typically off-meta picks, that doesn't necessarily mean they're doing badly. I found the game in question and, honestly, looking at *all* the stats that are given, and considering those two were going with largely off-meta strategies, I'd say that they did about as well as OP did. Not wholly bad, but not great either.

As you improve, over time you will climb 100% guaranteed.

So it is impossible for bad teammates to hold you back.

You just need to learn how to carry them, and also how to make them play better.
